CONCLUSION

The Risk Management Plan implemented by the Facility complies with the requirements of the Clean Air Act, Section 112(r). The RMP will be updated as the Facility adds, deletes, or makes changes to the process. 

NOTE: Sections 4, 5, 6, and 8 of the standard RMP produced by EPA's RMP Submit Program are not applicable to the Facility.

ll the contents in the largest single PV (i.e. 29,998 gallons) are released.   The release scenario consists of the PV being punctured on the side at the ground level and the release is modeled as a ground level horizontal jet at the maximum temperature.

The alternative (or more likely to occur) scenario assumes a 30-second release from a failure of a 2-inch transfer hose caused by an impact, pull-away, material defect, or overpressurization during a transfer operation.  Mitigation by engineering and administrative controls is considered in these scenarios.  

ACCIDENT PREVENTION PROGRAM

The Chief Regulatory Officer implements the risk management planning process at this Facility. The Chief Regulatory Officer is assisted by other trained personnel as directed. The Chief Regulatory Officer is responsible for ensuring that its employees are properly trained in the implementation of the Program 3 Accident Prevention Program elements as related to their responsibilities.  The accident prevention program elements addressed in the PSM/RMP combined program includes: Management System, Employee Participation, Process Safety Information, Process Hazard Analysis, Operating Procedures, Training, Contractor, Pre-Startup Review, Mechanical Integrity, Hot Work Permit, Management of Change, Incident Investigation, Emergency Response, Compliance Audits, and Trade Secrets.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

This is a non-responding Facility.   The Facility has coordinated emergency response activities with its local emergency response agency and local fire department.

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

There have been no on-site deaths, injuries, or significant property damage; or off-site deaths, injuries, property damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place, in the past five (5) years because of the ammonia operations at this Facility.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

In general, the following changes to improve safety of the covered processes at this Facility include:

	Install appropr

This EPA RMP was prepared in accordance with the requirements of the Clean Air Act § 112(r), OSHA 29 CFR § 1910.119, and U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) at 40 CFR §68. The OSHA PSM and EPA Subpart D RMP standards are applicable to operations at this Facility.  The electronic RMP summarizes the policies and procedures implemented by the Facility to minimize the likelihood of an accident. The electronic RMP also summarizes the actions that the Facility has taken to ensure that a response to a release will be implemented in a proper and timely manner.

PURPOSE FOR UPDATING RMP

The Facility is submitting this as a 5-year update.  All relevant sections of the Facility RMPr have been reviewed and/or updated.  

FACILITY

The operations at this Facility consist of chemical storage and handling, blending, retail sale and distribution.  The Facility operates one (1) covered process that includes Storage and Handling of anhydrous ammonia at quantities that exceed the regulatory threshold quantity.  Anhydrous ammonia is transported to this Facility by a third party owned and operated commercial cargo truck.  The cargo truck Operator transfers anhydrous ammonia from the commercial cargo truck to one stationary pressure vessel (PV) with a capacity equal to 29,998-gallons. 

The Facility stores the anhydrous ammonia in the stationary PV and then transfers the anhydrous ammonia from the PV to the Facility-owned Mobile Pipe Reactor to produce Ammonium Polyphosphate fertilizer by blending anhydrous ammonia with super-phosphoric acid in a reacting chamber and then mixing the hot melt with water.  Trained Process Operators perform the transfer of anhydrous ammonia and operate the Mobile Pipe Reactor in accordance with its PSM/RMPr accident prevention program.
